checkersMain
Class CheckersBoard

java.lang.Object
  checkersMain.CheckersBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BitCheckersBoard, DefaultCheckersBoard
public abstract class CheckersBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class is designed to hold data on the positioning and types of Checkers pieces on a CheckersBoard. It also will generate all possible plies a player can make and the resulting successor CheckersBoards. Player1 is the only player that can take a ply, so the board should be inverted between player turns.

Version:
1.20 - 3 August 2008
Author:
Amos Yuen

Nested Class Summary

          A package class for a possible ply that can be taken for a CheckersBoard.

getChar

public static char getChar(byte pieceType)
Returns a char that represents that passed pieceType

Parameters:
pieceType - - one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, or EMPTY
Returns:
the char that represents the pieceType

getColumn

public static int getColumn(int index)
Returns the column of the passed index.

Parameters:
index - - board location in the range [0,31] (top-left corner being zero and bottom-right corner being 31. The index increases from left-to-right first, then from top-to-bottom)
Returns:
the column of the passed index, or -1 if an invalid index

getIndex

public static int getIndex(int row,
                           int col)
Returns the corresponding index for the passed row and column.

Parameters:
row - - row location in the range [0,7] (topmost being zero)
col - - column location in the range [0,7] (leftmost being zero)
Returns:
the corresponding index for the passed row and column or -1 if passed invalid parameters.

getNeighborIndex

public static byte getNeighborIndex(byte index,
                                    byte direction)
Returns the index of the neighbouring board location in the passed direction from the passed starting index. If the location is off the board, an invalid index will be returned.

Parameters:
index - - board location in the range [0,31] (top-left corner being zero and bottom-right corner being 31. The index increases from left-to-right first, then from top-to-bottom)
direction - - one of NORTH_WEST, NORTH_EAST, SOUTH_WEST, or SOUTH_EAST
Returns:
the location of the neighbouring board location

getRow

public static int getRow(int index)
Returns the row of the passed index.

Parameters:
index - - board location in the range [0,31] (top-left corner being zero and bottom-right corner being 31. The index increases from left-to-right first, then from top-to-bottom)
Returns:
the row of the passed index, or -1 if an invalid index

invertPiece

public static byte invertPiece(byte pieceType)
Returns the piece with the player inverted, if the pieceType is owned by a player.

Parameters:
pieceType - - one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, EMPTY, or OFFBOARD
Returns:
the piece with the player inverted, if any. It will be one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, EMPTY, or OFFBOARD

upgrade

public static byte upgrade(byte pieceType)
Returns a king owned by the same player, if the passed pieceType is a checker, else it returns the pieceType.

Parameters:
pieceType - - one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, EMPTY, or OFFBOARD
Returns:
the upgraded piece type if applicable. It will be one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, EMPTY, or OFFBOARD

Should return a clone of the current CheckersBoard such that equals(CheckersBoard) returns true and their classes are equal.

other - - the other CheckersBoard to compare with

whether the boards are equal

Frees any caching.

getCount

public int getCount(byte pieceType)
Counts the number of pieces of the passed piece type in this CheckersBoard

Parameters:
pieceType - - one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, or EMPTY
Returns:
the number of pieces of piece type in this CheckersBoard

getNumPlies

public abstract int getNumPlies()
Returns the number of possible plies, which should correspond with the number of successor boards. This method should return the same value as getNumSuccessors(), but in the case that nothing is cached, it will create a list of plies to determine the plies count.

Returns:
the number of possible plies
See Also:
getPly(int)

getNumSuccessors

public abstract int getNumSuccessors()
Returns the number of successor boards, which should correspond with the number of possible plies. This method should return the same value as getNumPlies(), but in the case that nothing is cached, it will create a list of successor boards to determine the plies count.

Returns:
the number of successor boards
See Also:
getSuccessor(int)

getPiece

public abstract byte getPiece(int index)
Returns the contents of the specified board location.

Parameters:
index - - board location in the range [0,31] (top-left corner being zero and bottom-right corner being 31. The index increases from left-to-right first, then from top-to-bottom)
Returns:
one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, EMPTY, or OFFBOARD

getPiece

public abstract byte getPiece(int row,
                              int col)
Returns the contents of the specified board location.

Parameters:
row - - row location in the range [0,7] (topmost being zero)
col - - column location in the range [0,7] (leftmost being zero)
Returns:
one of PLAYER1_CHECKER, PLAYER1_KING, PLAYER2_CHECKER, PLAYER2_KING, EMPTY, or OFFBOARD

getPly

public abstract CheckersBoard.Ply getPly(int index)
Assuming it's Player1's turn, it returns the possible ply corresponding to the passed index. The indices of the plies in the returned list should correspond to the indices of the successor boards in the list returned from getSuccessor(int).

Parameters:
index - - the index of the ply to retrieve
Returns:
the ply corresponding to the passed index
See Also:
getNumPlies(), CheckersBoard.Ply

getSuccessor

public abstract CheckersBoard getSuccessor(int index)
Assuming it's Player1's turn, it returns the CheckersBoard resulting from the ply at the corresponding index. The indices of the successor boards returned should correspond to the indices of the plies returned from getPly(int).

Parameters:
index - - the index of the successor to retrieve
Returns:
the resulting CheckersBoard from the corresponding ply
See Also:
getNumSuccessors()

invertCheckersBoard

public abstract CheckersBoard invertCheckersBoard()
Creates a new board and it switches Player2 and Player1 pieces and up and down directions, effectively allowing it to always be "PLAYER1's turn" and Player1 to always be moving "up" even as play alternates between two players. The inverted CheckersBoard will be cached. Note: this method in combination with the caching of successor boards can cause memory to not be released. Use the freeCache() method to help with this.

Returns:
the inverted CheckersBoard

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
